entry.title: Finding Currajong - Fuzzy string searches in Python
entry.summary:
Description

With the advent of Big Data, data scrubbing (finding matches in imperfect data) becomes an important issue. In this talk I will look at several algorithms for doing partial matches on strings and names and compare some strengths and weaknesses of each approach. We will also look at Python code and libraries for this work.

entry.title: Python for Bioinformatics for learning Python
entry.summary:
Description

Martin Schweitzer https://2016.pycon-au.org/schedule/89/view_talk In this talk I will explain why Python is an excellent language for learning about bioinformatics. I intend to make a compelling case in favour of using Python as a first language for teaching bioinformatics.

I will then explain how bioinformatics can be a useful vehicle for learning Python.

Finally, we will visit a site where users can learn both Python and bioinformatics in a stimulating, engaging and motivating environment.

The talk will assume familiarity with Python, but does not assume any knowledge of bioinformatics.
